DataElement.preferredName: Patient Interference Brachytherapy Implant Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response indicating whether or not the patient has interference with having a brachytherapy implant placed that meets the eligibility requirements for participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Interference Brachytherapy Implant Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding._A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material is placed inside the body, into a tumor or body cavity._A prosthesis placed permanently in tissue._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Interference Brachytherapy Implant Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding._A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material is placed inside the body, into a tumor or body cavity._A prosthesis placed permanently in tissue._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding.
A type of radiation therapy in which radioactive material is placed inside the body, into a tumor or body cavity.
A prosthesis placed permanently in tissue.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, Unknown, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 requested By Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership  transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/23/16 jk value "Not evaluable" added in error by COG on 3/21/16 was removed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient has interference with having a brachytherapy implant placed?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Participant has an anatomy that would preclude precise brachytherapy implant (such as arch interference or large median lobe).
